intro: Veronica angustissima, commonly known as narrowleaf speedwell, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, blue or violet flowers in whorls along the stems, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy surface. Veronica angustissima thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks.
